intro: Gompholobium subulatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf burrwing, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and distinctive yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring. It often grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Gompholobium subulatum is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
